result.execSummary:
The defendant Fritz M Scheuch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with La Crosse Co cases 14CM1041, 15CM189, 15CM633, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Comply with mental health needs and follow-through with any recommendations made

Take all prescribed medications as directed
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol, drugs, or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with M.A.M. or her residence
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay restitution and surcharge as shown in 14CM1041

Complete any other conditions deemed appropriate by the PO

Court costs/fees are remitted by the Court

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 21 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoke or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
Can be served on EM through JSS.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 15CM189 & 15CM633.

10:30 am Def in court w/ Atty Keith Allen Belzer.  Def in custody.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Eklund agrees with the DOC's recommendations...  Belzer comments and doesn't obj. to 7-9 by the Dept.  Asks for the balance on house arrest....  Scheuch comments.  Court addresses Def. 
SENTENCES:  15CM-189 - 50 days CJ w/35 days credit.  15CM-633 - 50 days CJ - consecutive to 15CM-189 w/35 days credit.  15CM-684 - 50 days CJ - consecutive to 15CM-633 w/10 days credit.  15CM-1606 - 50 days CJ - consecutive to 15CM-684.  14CM-1041 - 100 days CJ - consecutive to 15CM-1606  All jail can be served on em.
